espnscrapeR 0.1.0
  • Reference

Scrape NFL stats from nfl.com at the team level.

Source: R/scrape_team_stats_nfl.R
scrape_team_stats_nfl.Rd

Please note that the column names are identical between offense/defense and you should reference the 'role' column for offensive or defensive stats.

scrape_team_stats_nfl(
  season = 2019,
  stats = "GAME_STATS",
  role = "offense",
  season_type = "Regular"
)

Arguments

season

character or numeric - greater than 1970
stats

character - either "GAME_STATS", "SCORING", "TEAM_PASSING", "TEAM_RUSHING", "TEAM_RECEIVING", or "OFFENSIVE_LINE"
role

character - "offense" or "defense"
season_type

character - either 'Regular' or 'Playoffs'

Value

tibble

Examples


# Get the NFL.com game-level stats for offense in 2018
scrape_team_stats_nfl(season = 2018, stats = "GAME_STATS", role = "offense")
#> Scraping GAME_STATS for offense from 2018 Regular!
#> # A tibble: 32 x 25
#>     rank team  games pts_game pts_total plays_scrimmage yds_game yds_play
#>    <int> <chr> <int>    <dbl>     <int>           <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1     1 Kans…    16     35.3       565             996     426.      6.8
#>  2     2 Los …    16     32.9       527            1060     421.      6.4
#>  3     3 Tamp…    16     24.8       396            1055     416.      6.3
#>  4     4 Pitt…    16     26.8       428            1058     403.      6.1
#>  5     5 New …    16     27.2       436            1073     393.      5.9
#>  6     6 Atla…    16     25.9       414            1010     389.      6.2
#>  7     7 Indi…    16     27.1       433            1070     386.      5.8
#>  8     8 New …    16     31.5       504            1010     379.      6  
#>  9     9 Balt…    16     24.3       389            1135     375.      5.3
#> 10    10 Caro…    16     23.5       376            1011     373.      5.9
#> # … with 22 more rows, and 17 more variables: first_down_g <dbl>,
#> #   third_conv <int>, third_att <int>, third_pct <dbl>, fourth_conv <int>,
#> #   fourth_att <int>, fourth_pct <int>, penalty <int>, penalty_yds <dbl>,
#> #   time_of_poss <dbl>, fumbles_total <int>, fumbles_lost <int>,
#> #   turnover_ratio <int>, stat <chr>, season <dbl>, season_type <chr>,
#> #   role <chr>

# Get the NFL.com team-level passing stats for defense in 2014
scrape_team_stats_nfl(season = "2014", stats = "TEAM_PASSING", role = "defense")

#> # A tibble: 32 x 25
